review: i bought 2 of these, and am generally quite a happy user.especially as an xbmc player, installed via sideloader, this box is fantastic!so, the positives are obvious:affordably priced xbmc player, performant enough to run video files from a network sharealso plays nicely things from the installed version of the amazon storenow the cons:Once you get used to the comfort, you want more! but:Most of things you can purchase from the amazon store, even shown as compatible, are NOT!You can install some apk via the sideloader and many seem to work fine but a few dont,Main problem are input device and google-android-store dependenciesimprovement suggestions to amazon:- dont show apps as compatible in the app store that dont install as compatible! this is really a minimum requirement!!! extremely annoying!!- support the google app store! that'd be such a 'WOW'!!!- in the amazon store, point to some valid apk in case the auto-installer doesnt pickup an app. now this would be such a help!! would make it feel like almost 'open'!!!else, in the short-term, this thing is going to become totally obsolete by such things as the RASPBERRY PI 2 or the ODROID. they cost less and perform as good and completely support the android store and all open apps...

review: Don't waste your money.We received it as a wedding gift. Initially we struggled to even get it to download the initial setup operations. We went through all the FAQs, all the suggested helps. It literally took messing with it everyday for a total of about 12 hours to get it running. And ever since, over a month now, we still can't get anything to play straight through. Either we get "no internet connection" ... Check settings, Internet is "very good." Or "UNKNOWN_ERROR" please try again later. Or even worse... It freezes at the circle of death mid program or movie. Can not recommend this product at all.
